private_information: You are agent_1 and are allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E only.
You can only move a disk if it is currently the top disk of a peg.
You must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the final Tower of Hanoi configuration: left peg top-to-bottom E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A,B,C,D by producing an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform.

private_information: You are agent_2 and are allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J only.
You can only move a disk if it is currently the top disk of a peg.
You must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the final Tower of Hanoi configuration: left peg top-to-bottom E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A,B,C,D by producing an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform.

private_information: You coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and must integrate their move lists into a single valid plan.
You are responsible for producing the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner.
Keep the actions of the two agents distinct when modeling the multi-agent plan.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move lists and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encode the cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution and are compatible with FastDownwards.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 10 disks labeled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Initial configuration has all disks stacked on the left peg from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Goal configuration requires left peg to contain top-to-bottom E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D.
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved at a time.
A disk moved must be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk; placing a larger disk on a smaller disk is forbidden.
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move only A-E and agent_2 may move only F-J.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 assigned to generate an ordered list of primitive moves. Provide a sequence of moves that you will perform given your disk permissions. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and never move disks you are not allowed to move. Output the list in the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Only list the moves that this agent will execute.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private facts: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not produce PDDL.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 assigned to generate an ordered list of primitive moves. Provide a sequence of moves that you will perform given your disk permissions. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and never move disks you are not allowed to move. Output the list in the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Only list the moves that this agent will execute.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private facts: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating the move lists of agent_1 and agent_2 and producing a final PDDL domain and problem file targeted to the FastDownwards planner. Build a single-domain PDDL that encodes three pegs, the ten disks, the Tower of Hanoi legality constraints, and two distinct move actions (one for agent_1 moves and one for agent_2 moves) so actions remain identifiable by agent. Ensure the problem encodes the initial and goal configurations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. The PDDL should be compatible with FastDownwards requirements.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Inputs: the public environment facts {environment->public_information} and the planned move lists from agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Your private facts: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate and validate the agents' move sequences, resolve any naming mismatches, and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the final PDDL models the cooperative solution. Enclose the domain between <domain> and </domain> and the problem between <problem> and </problem>.
